chargeHist.descr: Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Deion J. Boivin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-In Public [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Consecutive to 15CF147.

Give DNA sample.

Write letter of apology to the victim and provide to the DA's office within 10 days.
All financials same as noted above.

After testimony from defendant and statements from the Jail Administrator and Work Release supervisor, court denies the defendant's motion to reinstate his huber privileges.
motion to reinstate huber privileges  (see 15CF147 for documents)

Defendant Deion J. Boivin in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Defendant Deion J. Boivin in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire received and reviewed.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest.    Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Court takes judicial notice of mother's prior testimony in 14CF69.  Remarks by Atty. Niemi and Atty. Siehr.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant Deion J. Boivin in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Defendant Deion J. Boivin in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Deion J. Boivin in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Defendant Deion J. Boivin in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer sworn in and testifies.  Identifes the defendant in court today.  Cross exam by Atty Haacke.  No re-direct.  ADA Niemi asks for bind over.  Atty Haacke requests the Judge not bind over.  Probable cause found for bind over.  Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
